body.p:
Brownsville Ky April 1861
To His Excelency Honr Beriah Mcgoffin

Your Petitioners Would Respectfully Represent To your honor that Joseph Lewis Sr was fined at the March Term of the Edmondson Equity & Criminal Court Twenty Dollars for Betting Ten cents on a Game of Chuckluck We would Represent to your honor that Mr Lewis is a very Poore Man and that he has a Large family to support and that his Wife is a very Sickly Wooman and that he is scarcely abel to pay Support his family and that it would be a Great Hardship for him to have to pay the said fine that if he is compeled to pay the fine that it will be Taking it from his Wife and Children We therefore hope that your Honor will Remit the fine as Mr Lewis is not a betting Man he is not in the Habit of Betting and by Remiting it you will confer a Lasting favor on a Poor Man and his family
